segments.text: I see the woman, so diligently polishing her dish.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She's completely in her own world, a picture of domestic routine.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But how can she not feel the water around her ankle?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The sink is truly overflowing, a steady waterfall onto the cabinets.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s astonishing, her complete lack of awareness.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her expression is utterly neutral, as if nothing is amiss.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Then there are the children, plotting their cookie heist.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is so precarious on that stool, it makes my heart jump.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: His sister's expectant face is priceless, though.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: They’re so focused on their sweet prize, oblivious to the rising tide.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s a bizarre tableau, these three figures in their separate realities.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I truly am taken aback by the sheer disconnect in this kitchen.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The contrast with the peaceful garden view is almost comical.
segments.speaker: PAR
